title: Real-world measures of center
prompt: The seven houses on a street have the values $105,000; $110,000; $110,000; $117,500; $125,000; $135,000; and $138,000. A realtor assigns a housing value to the street of $120,000. What mathematical measure did the realtor use to find this value?
hint: Test each answer by finding that value for the given data, and comparing it to the realtor's value.
feedback: The mean of a group of numbers is what we often refer to as the average. To calculate the mean, you add together a series of numbers and then divide by the number of numbers in the series. In this case, the mean of the house values is a little over $120,071. This rounds to $120,000, the realtor’s housing value.
